apiClassifier.shortdesc: a subclass of overlay that will render dashed great-circle arcs

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: a subclass of overlay that will render dashed great-circle arcs

apiOperation.shortdesc:
you can specify different units by optionally providing the earth's radius in the units you desire
Default is 6,378,000 metres, suggested values are:
3963.1 statute miles 3443.9 nautical miles 6378 km

apiReturn.apiDesc: distance between given start and end locations in metres

apiDesc.p: you can specify different units by optionally providing the earth's radius in the units you desire

apiOperation.shortdesc: Call javascript:modestMaps.copyright() with details about current view.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Call javascript:modestMaps.copyright() with details about current view. See js/copyright.js.

apiOperation.shortdesc:
this function gets exposed to javascript as a callback
to display the copyright string in your flash piece, you then need to listen for the COPYRIGHT_CHANGED MapEvent, or add MapCopyright as a child of map for a basic implementation.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
this function gets exposed to javascript as a callback
to display the copyright string in your flash piece, you then need to listen for the COPYRIGHT_CHANGED MapEvent, or add MapCopyright as a child of map for a basic implementation.

apiValue.shortdesc: htmlText to be added to a label - listen for MapEvent.COPYRIGHT_CHANGED

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: htmlText to be added to a label - listen for MapEvent.COPYRIGHT_CHANGED

apiClassifier.shortdesc: this is a bit of a silly class really, implementing a whole mini layout framework just so that you don't have to have the same button layout that I like.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
this is a bit of a silly class really, implementing a whole mini layout framework just so that you don't have to have the same button layout that I like.
even though you have to have rounded corners and bevels.
take that!

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Overlay simplifies adding vector graphics to your map.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Overlay simplifies adding vector graphics to your map. Subclass Overlay and override the redraw(sprite:Sprite) method to use it.

apiOperation.shortdesc: redraw the overlay onto the given Sprite - override this in your subclass

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: redraw the overlay onto the given Sprite - override this in your subclass

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is an example of a slider that modifies the zoom level of the given map.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
This is an example of a slider that modifies the zoom level of the given map.
It is provided mainly for ModestMapsSample.as and to test the arbitrary zoom level functionality, but feel free to use it if you like yellow bevels.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: NavigatorWindow creates a small navigator map that will stick to the bottom right-hand edge of a map and provide a zoomed-out context for the current visible area.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
NavigatorWindow creates a small navigator map that will stick to the bottom right-hand edge of a map and provide a zoomed-out context for the current visible area.
The main 'magic' performed by this class is suppressing the map events from the nav map so that they don't bubble up and confused overlays that are listening to the map. This would be an issue because the navigator window might be added as a child of map. I considered making it an option in Map and TileGrid to disable events, but then I realised I wanted the navMap to be interactive after all so that it could update the main map.
Hat tip to http://www.cartogrammar.com/blog/map-panning-and-zooming-methods/ for prompting the development of this class.
Exercises for the reader: 1) add alignment options (top left etc.)? 2) add show and hide buttons 3) add dragging for resizing 4) add optional alternate map providers (a la maps.live.com)?

apiConstructor.shortdesc: create a new navigator window with optional size and style parameters

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: create a new navigator window with optional size and style parameters
